alert.note: Alert for Pickens; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 1:34PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Tuscaloosa and southeastern Pickens Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 132 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from Samantha to Aliceville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Tuscaloosa, Northport, Aliceville, Gordo, Coker, Samantha, Benevola, Johnston Lake, Lake Lurleen State Park, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, Bankhead Lock And Dam, Binion Creek Landing, Lake Tuscaloosa, Dillburg, Moores Bridge, Windham Springs, Flatwoods, Fosters Boat Landing and Stillman College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
